questions.text: Chandelier sign is seen in?

A 25y old lady presented to the ER with c/o spotting and acute abdominal pain since a few hours, which has been increasing. A urine pregnancy test is weakly positive. On examination, her PR is 110/ min. BP is 100/60 mmHg. Abdominal exam reveals guarding and rigidity. An ultrasound shows significant free fluid in the pelvis. What is the next best step?

A 30-year-old pregnant woman has a large, well-circumscribed, hyperechoic mass arising from the placenta seen on ultrasound. Color Doppler shows blood flow within the mass. The AFI is 24. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A 40 y woman comes to the OPD for pre-conceptional counseling. She is at increased risk of all the following except?
Which of the following cardiovascular changes occurs normally in pregnancy?

options.label: D
options.text: Decrease in heart rate by 10 beats per minute

questions.correct_answer: C. Increase in cardiac output by 30–50%
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Increase in cardiac output by 30–50%

questions.text: Assertion (A): There is physiological anemia during pregnancy. Reason (R): Plasma volume increases more than red blood cell mass.

options.label: A
options.text: Both A and R are true, and R is the correct explanation of A

options.label: B
options.text: Both A and R are true, but R is not the correct explanation of A

options.label: C
options.text: A is true, R is false

options.label: D
options.text: A is false, R is true

questions.correct_answer: A. Both A and R are true, and R is the correct explanation of A
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Both A and R are true, and R is the correct explanation of A

questions.text: The glomerular filtration rate (GFR) during pregnancy:

options.label: D
options.text: Increases only in the third trimester

questions.text: Which of the following hormone levels decreases during normal pregnancy?
The maneuver shown below is used for?

options.label: A
options.text: Active management of 3rd stage of labor

questions.text: During this maneuver, the cord snaps and the placenta remains inside. A manual removal of placenta is attempted but the placenta fails to separate. There is no excessive vaginal bleeding. What is the next best step?

options.label: A
options.text: USG to rule out adherent placenta

options.label: B
options.text: Removal of placenta in the OT under GA

questions.correct_answer: A. USG to rule out adherent placenta
questions.explanation: Ans. A) USG to rule out adherent placenta

questions.text: A 30y G3 P2 with previous cesarean section presents at 36 weeks for her 1st ANC. An ultrasound shows the following image. The FHR is 140bpm and there is no evidence of fetal distress. The uterus is relaxed, corresponding to 36 weeks and non tense or tender. What is the next best step?

options.label: A
options.text: Schedule an elective LSCS in the next few days

questions.correct_answer: A. Schedule an elective LSCS in the next few days
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Schedule an elective LSCS in the next few days

questions.text: You are shown a fluid monitoring chart of a woman on MgSO₄ therapy for eclampsia. Chart details: BP: 140/90 mmHg Pulse: 96/min RR: 14/min Urine output: 8 am to 10 am → 50 ml/hr 10 am to 12 pm → 35 ml/hr 12 pm to 2 pm → 25 ml/hr 2 pm to 4 pm → 15 ml/hr Patellar reflex: Present but sluggish SpO₂: 98% on room air Based on the chart, what should be your next best step?

options.label: B
options.text: Continue MgSO₄ and monitor vitals hourly

options.label: C
options.text: Stop MgSO₄ infusion temporarily and monitor serum magnesium levels

options.label: D
options.text: Shift patient to ICU and intubate

questions.correct_answer: C. Stop MgSO₄ infusion temporarily and monitor serum magnesium levels
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Stop MgSO₄ infusion temporarily and monitor serum magnesium levels

questions.text: A 30-year-old woman at 32 weeks presents with BP 170/110 mmHg, platelets 80,000/mm³, AST 150 IU/L, ALT 160 IU/L, LDH 800 IU/L. She has no seizures yet. Most appropriate next step?

options.label: A
options.text: Start MgSO₄ and plan immediate delivery

options.label: B
options.text: Continue pregnancy till 37 weeks under observation

options.label: C
options.text: Give steroids for lung maturity and wait 48 hours

options.label: D
options.text: Only monitor BP and liver enzymes

questions.correct_answer: A. Start MgSO₄ and plan immediate delivery
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Start MgSO₄ and plan immediate delivery

questions.text: A woman with eclampsia is on standard Pritchard regimen. She has another seizure 4 hours after loading dose. Her respiratory rate is 18/min, reflexes present, urine output 50 ml/hr. Best management now?
questions.correct_answer: A. Administer additional 2g MgSO₄ IV bolus
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Administer additional 2 g MgSO₄ IV bolus

questions.text: A 32-week pregnant woman presents with painless bleeding per vaginum. Uterus is non-tender. Fetal heart sounds are normal. On PV examination, brisk bleeding starts. Most probable diagnosis?

A 36-week woman with suspected abruption has tense, tender uterus, absent fetal heart sounds. Vaginal exam reveals the cervix is 2cm dilated, Vx at -2 and the pelvis adequate. What is the best immediate next step?
A 32-week pregnant woman with PPROM has no labor pain and no signs of infection. What is the most appropriate management?
questions.correct_answer: B. Administer steroids, antibiotics, and observe
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Administer steroids, antibiotics, and observe

questions.text: A 30-week woman with painful contractions and cervical dilation is given tocolytics. Which additional intervention improves neonatal outcome?
questions.correct_answer: A. IV magnesium sulfate for neuroprotection
questions.explanation: Ans. A) IV magnesium sulfate for neuroprotection

questions.text: In monochorionic twins, Stage 3 TTTS is diagnosed by which critical finding?

options.label: B
options.text: Absent or reversed end-diastolic flow in donor twin

questions.correct_answer: B. Absent or reversed end-diastolic flow in donor twin
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Absent or reversed end-diastolic flow in donor twin

questions.text: In twin pregnancy at 37 weeks, one twin is cephalic, second is breech. Best mode of delivery?

options.label: B
options.text: Vaginal delivery if first twin cephalic

options.label: D
options.text: Wait for spontaneous labor and vaginal deliver

questions.correct_answer: B. Vaginal delivery if first twin cephalic
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Vaginal delivery if first twin cephalic

questions.text: A woman has FGR fetus with absent end-diastolic flow in umbilical artery Doppler at 32 weeks. Next best step?

options.label: B
options.text: Administer steroids and repeat Doppler in 24–48 hours

options.label: D
options.text: Amniocentesis to check for fetal lung maturity

questions.correct_answer: B. Administer steroids and repeat Doppler in 24–48 hours
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Administer steroids and repeat Doppler in 24–48 hours

questions.text: Which Doppler finding suggests fetal compromise needing immediate delivery?

options.label: C
options.text: Reversed end-diastolic flow in umbilical artery

options.label: D
options.text: Increased middle cerebral artery peak systolic velocity

questions.correct_answer: C. Reversed end-diastolic flow in umbilical artery
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Reversed end-diastolic flow in umbilical artery

questions.text: A 32-week GDM woman on insulin is given betamethasone for preterm labor risk. What adjustment is needed?

options.label: B
options.text: Increase insulin dose during steroid course

questions.correct_answer: B. Increase insulin dose during steroid course
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Increase insulin dose during steroid course

questions.text: Which anticoagulant is safest in pregnancy for mechanical heart valves?

options.label: B
options.text: Low molecular weight heparin throughout pregnancy, switch to warfarin at term

options.label: C
options.text: Unfractionated heparin for 1st and 3rd trimester, warfarin in the 2nd

questions.correct_answer: C. Unfractionated heparin for 1st and 3rd trimester, warfarin in the 2nd
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Unfractionated heparin for 1st and 3rd trimester, warfarin in the 2nd

questions.text: A 41-week pregnancy shows reduced amniotic fluid index (AFI = 4 cm) and normal Doppler. Next best step?
A 36-week pregnant woman has intense pruritus and serum bile acids 48 µmol/L. AST and ALT are mildly elevated. Best management?

options.label: A
options.text: Ursodeoxycholic acid and expectant management till 40 weeks

questions.text: During instrumental delivery with vacuum, there is failure to deliver after 3 pulls. Next best step?
Following a normal vaginal delivery, a woman suddenly collapses with hypotension, tachycardia, and respiratory distress. Which of the following is most likely?

A multigravida woman at full dilation has been in the 2nd stage of labor since 2 hours. The CTG is normal. Uterine contractions are 4 in 10 mins lasting for 40-45 seconds. on vaginal examination, direct occipitoposterior position is confirmed. There is no caput or moulding and the vertex is at +1. What is the next best step?

options.label: B
options.text: Allow more time with good contractions

questions.text: Which is incorrect regarding this image?

options.label: A
options.text: The risk of TTTS is in about 10% in this type of twinning

options.label: B
options.text: On ultrasound, a twin peak sign is visible

options.label: C
options.text: The sex of the fetuses can be different

options.label: D
options.text: Placenta previa is a known complication

questions.correct_answer: A. The risk of TTTS is in about 10% in this type of twinning
questions.explanation: Ans. A) The risk of TTTS is in about 10% in this type of twinning

questions.text: Look at the image here. What could a possible complication be?
A G2 presented at 12 weeks for an ultrasound. The measurement taken as shown was found to be 3.2 mm. What is the next best step?

options.label: B
options.text: Review at 18 weeks for level 2 scan

questions.text: A 28-year-old primigravida attends her first antenatal visit at 10 weeks. Which of the following should not be routinely offered at this visit?
Regarding iron and folic acid supplementation during pregnancy, which is true?

options.label: A
options.text: Only folic acid 5 mg/day should be given throughout pregnancy

options.label: B
options.text: Iron 100 mg + Folic acid 500 mcg daily should be started after first trimester

options.label: C
options.text: Iron 100 mg + Folic acid 500 mcg daily should be started from the second trimester onwards

options.label: D
options.text: Folic acid is not required if iron is given

questions.correct_answer: C. Iron 100 mg + Folic acid 500 mcg daily should be started from the second trimester onwards
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Iron 100 mg + Folic acid 500 mcg daily should be started from the second trimester onwards

questions.text: Which of the following vaccines is contraindicated during pregnancy?
A pregnant woman exposed to parvovirus B19 develops mild fever and rash. Which fetal complication is most feared?
At 28 weeks, a Rh-negative woman has negative antibody screen. Best course of action?

options.label: D
options.text: Administer anti-D only after delivery if baby is Rh-positive

questions.text: A woman with diagnosed APLA is on enoxaparin and aspirin. She develops a massive placental abruption at 34 weeks. Immediate next step?

options.label: B
options.text: Stop anticoagulation immediately and prepare for delivery

questions.correct_answer: B. Stop anticoagulation immediately and prepare for delivery
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Stop anticoagulation immediately and prepare for delivery

questions.text: At 20 weeks, a woman with no pain or contractions is found to have cervical length of 18 mm on transvaginal ultrasound. No funneling seen. No history of pregnancy loss. What is the next best step?

A 25 y primigravida at 38 weeks presents to the labor room with intermittent abdominal pain since 5 h. Vaginal examination reveals: Cervix is 6 cm dilated 0.5 cm long Presenting part at 0 station The presenting part is ……….

A woman with the following obstetric performance attends the OPD at 32 weeks pregnancy 2017 – Term pregnancy, vaginal delivery, baby alive 2018 – Medical Termination of Pregnancy at 8 weeks 2010 – Twin pregnancy, cesarean delivery at 36 weeks, 1 baby alive
The correct placement of the instrument shown on the fetal head is at:
This NST is best interpreted as
Identify the procedure being done
Identify the part of the fallopian tube being ligated in this procedure?

A 21y girl with lower abdominal pain is found to have an ovarian lesion measuring 6 x 7 cm as shown on ultrasound. A risk of malignancy index is calculated which is found to be 1200. What is the next best step?
The following illustration demonstrates which maneuver for reduction of shoulder dystocia?

A 22-year-old primigravida has been pushing for 3 hours. The fetus is in persistent occiput posterior position with caput, and the fetal head is noted to protrude slightly through the introitus with each contraction. Which of the following features must be considered prior to attempted forceps delivery?

options.label: A
options.text: The head may not be engaged

options.label: B
options.text: At this station the pelvis is adequate

options.label: D
options.text: At this point low forceps may be applied without further evaluation

questions.correct_answer: C. Diagnosed visually the station is +3
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Diagnosed visually the station is +3

questions.text: Which of the following is an absolute contraindication to external cephalic version?
What is true concerning the illustrated perineal episiotomy below?

Your patient is a 45-year-old with a Pap test result of high-grade squamous intraepithelial lesion (HSIL). Subsequent colposcopy is unsatisfactory due to incomplete visualization of the squamocolumnar junction. Cervical biopsy confirms a CIN 3 lesion. Which of the following is the most appropriate procedure for further diagnosis and/or treatment?
A 45y lady is diagnosed with cervical cancer. On examination and investigations, it is found to be as shown. What is the stage?
In brachytherapy, how is point A defined?

options.label: A
options.text: 2 cm lateral and 2 cm superior to the external os

options.label: B
options.text: 5 cm lateral and 2 cm superior to the external os

options.label: C
options.text: 2 cm lateral and 5 cm superior to the external os

options.label: D
options.text: 5 cm lateral and 2 cm superior to the internal os

questions.correct_answer: A. 2 cm lateral and 2 cm superior to the external os
questions.explanation: Ans. A) 2 cm lateral and 2 cm superior to the external os

questions.text: A woman undergoes an exploratory laparotomy, total abdominal hysterectomy (TAH), bilateral salpingo-oophorectomy (BSO) for a solid pelvic mass, ascites, and an elevated serum cancer antigen 125 (CA125) level. Her preoperative chest radiograph is shown below. Frozen section demonstrates a benign ovarian neoplasm. What is the most likely diagnosis?

options.label: C
options.text: Metastatic cancer with a benign adnexal mass

options.label: D
options.text: Ovarian cancer—the frozen section was inaccurate.

questions.text: All except which of the following features are characteristic of complete hydatidiform molar pregnancies?

According to the modified prognostic scoring system of the World Health Organization (WHO), patients with which of the following score category are assigned to the high-risk gestational trophoblastic neoplasia (GTN) group?
During oophorectomy, the infundibulopelvic ligament is isolated prior to clamping, transection, and ligation. This ideally averts injury to which important structure?
The image below illustrates incision of the mesosalpinx, which is an early step performed in which of the following operative procedures?
Hysterectomy is one of the most frequently performed gynecologic procedures. During this abdominal procedure, the figure below illustrates which of the following?
Creation of a functional vagina is the treatment goal for many women with congenital agenesis of the vagina. Which of the following surgical procedures is commonly employed?
A 49y woman presents with heavy menstrual bleeding. On examination, the abdomen is soft. Speculum and bimanual exams are normal. A TVS shows the following. What is the next best step?

The patient pictured below presents complaining of the need to manually reduce the bulge by pushing her fingers inside the vagina every time she has to defecate—especially when she is constipated. Which of the following procedures is used to relieve her symptoms?

A 46y woman presents with a vaginal prolapse since a year and this has worsened since a few months. The gynecologist has made a grid which has the following mentioned. What do the “+” and “-” sign in the grid denote?

options.label: A
options.text: “+” denotes the prolapse is proximal to the hymen while “-” denotes the point is distal to the hymen

options.label: B
options.text: “+” denotes the prolapse is distal to the hymen while “-” denotes the point is proximal to the hymen

options.label: C
options.text: “+” denotes the prolapse is proximal to the introital opening while “-” denotes the point is distal to the introital opening

options.label: D
options.text: “+” denotes the prolapse is distal to the introital opening while “-” denotes the point is proximal to the introital opening

questions.correct_answer: B. “+” denotes the prolapse is distal to the hymen while “-” denotes the point is proximal to the hymen
questions.explanation: Ans. B) “+” denotes the prolapse is distal to the hymen while “-” denotes the point is proximal to the hymen

questions.text: Match the deformity with the corrective surgery needed:

A 27-year-old P2L2 teacher comes for contraceptive counselling. She has been using condoms but now wants something more long acting. She has regular periods lasting for 6 days and she uses the menstrual cup for the same but sometimes has to use additional pads also. She has been recently diagnosed with varicose veins in her legs but has no personal history of thrombo-embolism. She does not smoke or drink alcohol. Her vital signs are normal. Pelvic examination is normal. Which of the following is the most appropriate contraceptive choice?

A 23y woman is referred to the emergency soon after delivery. She is in shock. On examination, her PR is 120/min, BP is 70/40 mmHg. On abdominal exam, the uterus is not palpable and on vaginal exam, there is minimal bleeding but a mass is seen as shown. What is the diagnosis?

A 14y old girl visits the OPD with her mother. Her mother is anxious that she hasn’t achieved menarche yet. She says her elder daughter attained menarche at the age of 12y. The girl is doing well at school and enjoys sports. On examination, there is Tanner stage 3 breast development and pubic hair and axillary hair are present. What is the next best step?
Endocrinological changes occurring during menopause include all except:
A 24y woman presents with delayed cycles. An ultrasound shows the following image. What is the most effective ultrasound marker to detect polycystic ovarian morphology in adults?

A 35-year-old woman undergoing elective LSCS for placenta previa suddenly develops desaturation (SpO₂ 70%), hypotension, and coagulopathy (bleeding from IV sites, elevated PT, APTT) minutes after delivery of the baby. A diagnosis of AFE is made. Which of the following laboratory findings would most likely be seen?

options.label: A
options.text: Elevated D-dimer, prolonged PT, low fibrinogen

options.label: D
options.text: Low FDP, normal APTT, high platelets

questions.correct_answer: A. Elevated D-dimer, prolonged PT, low fibrinogen
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Elevated D-dimer, prolonged PT, low fibrinogen

questions.text: Which is incorrect regarding AMH?

options.label: A
options.text: Anti-Müllerian Hormone (AMH) is critical for physiologic involution of the Mullerian ducts during sexual differentiation in the male fetus

options.label: B
options.text: In women, AMH is a product of the small antral follicles in the ovaries and serves to function as an autocrine and paracrine regulator of follicular maturation

options.label: C
options.text: AMH is clinically useful as a screening tool for diminished ovarian reserve

options.label: D
options.text: A low AMH is good predictor of development of ovarian hyperstimulation syndrome

questions.correct_answer: D. A low AMH is good predictor of development of ovarian hyperstimulation syndrome
questions.explanation: Ans. D) A low AMH is good predictor of development of ovarian hyperstimulation syndrome

questions.text: Which is true regarding Swyer syndrome:
questions.correct_answer: C. Pregnancy possible with donor oocyte
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Pregnancy possible with donor oocyte

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: It has a lifespan of 5 years

options.text: It has a quick return to fertility on removal

questions.explanation: Ans. B) It has a lifespan of 5 years

questions.text: A 26y woman who is undergoing evaluation for infertility presents with this HSG film, done on day 8 of her periods. What is the next best step in management?

options.label: A
options.text: Repeat HSG after a course of antibiotics.

ERAS protocols are concerned with

options.label: B
options.text: Enhancing operative outcomes in gynecological surgeries

options.text: Enhancing breast feeding practices in post-partum women

options.text: There is evidence of tubercular salpingitis

questions.explanation: Ans. B) The fallopian tubes are patent

questions.text: A P1L1 has come for follow up one month after Cu T insertion. Cervix at speculum examination is as shown. What is the next best step?
questions.correct_answer: A. Reassure and review after 1 year
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Reassure and review after 1 year

questions.text: Chose the next step in the sequence of events in an abdominal hysterectomy: Clamp , cut and ligate round ligament Clamp, cut & ligate infundibulopelvic ligament/ ovarian ligament Open uterovesical fold of peritoneum Clamp, cut and ligate uterine vessels

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: Clamp and cut at the angles of the vault

options.label: D
options.text: Clamp, cut and ligate the broad ligament

questions.correct_answer: A. Clamp, cut and ligate the cardinal and uterosacral ligaments
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Clamp, cut and ligate the cardinal and uterosacral ligaments

options.label: B

options.text: Uterine anomaly with distortion of the uterine cavity

questions.text: Your 32-year-old patient has no complaints when presenting for a routine health maintenance visit but is found to have a clinically abnormal vaginal discharge during speculum examination of the vagina. A saline preparation of vaginal secretions demonstrates the motile pathogens shown here and marked by arrows. You have the NACO kits with you. Which kit will you prescribe to this patient?

options.label: D

questions.text: A fetus diagnosed with neural tube defect at 21 weeks. The parents want an MTP at 21 weeks. What opinions are required?

A 36y woman presents to the gyn OPD with secondary amenorrhoea. She has 1 child who is 8 years old, and she had a surgical termination of pregnancy done a year earlier. She says her mother attained menopause in her late thirties. Examination reveals a normal sized uterus, and no adnexal mass is palpable. Her pregnancy test is negative and her FSH is 6. What is the likely diagnosis?
As per the WHO Labor Care Guide, at what cervical dilatation should active phase begin?
A 24y is referred for colposcopy from the primary health center in view of a suspicious looking cervix for which the midwife has sent you the image shown below. What is the likely diagnosis?

A 35y woman presents to the emergency with severe dysmenorrhoea not responding to NSAIDs. She gives a history of worsening dysmenorrhoea and also has pain when passing stools. She does not give a history of constipation. Her periods are otherwise regular. On bimanual examination, the uterus is fixed and retroverted. On further history, she reveals that she hasn’t conceived despite being married for 3 years for which she was planning to show the gynecologist. What is the next best step?
